tight.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: tight clothes fit your body very closely, especially in a way that is uncomfortable
tight.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: My shoes were so tight that I could hardly walk.
The jacket is rather a tight fit  (=it fits too tightly).
tight.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: string, wire, cloth etc that is tight has been pulled or stretched firmly so that it is straight or cannot move
tight.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The bandage must be tight enough to stop the bleeding.
She tied the rope around the post and pulled it tight.
tight.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a screw, lid etc that is tight is firmly attached and difficult to move
tight.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Check that the screws are tight.
tight.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: controlling something very strictly or firmly
tight.translation[0].definitions[3].note: run/keep a tight ship (=manage a company, organization etc strictly and effectively)
tight.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The government is keeping tight control on immigration.
Security is always tight  for the opening day of parliament.
The former dictator still keeps a tight grip on power.
keep a tight grip/hold/rein on something
Anna was determined to keep a tight hold on her feelings.
keep a tight grip/hold/rein on something
tight.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if money is tight, you do not have enough of it
tight.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: As you know, I run the magazine on a pretty tight budget.
Money was tight and he needed a job badly.
tight.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if time is tight, it is difficult for you to do everything you need to do in the time available
tight.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Time is tight, and she has another meeting to go to this afternoon.
We should arrive on time, but it’ll be tight.
As usual, his schedule on Saturday was tight  (=he had arranged to do several things in a short time).
I'm working to a very tight deadline  (=I have to finish a piece of work very quickly).
tight.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: if space is tight, there is only just enough space to fit something into a place
tight.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: Six in the car will be a tight squeeze.
tight.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: not generous, or trying hard to avoid spending money
tight.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: The animal’s body was curled up in a tight little ball.
She wore her hair in a tight bun.
tight.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: a tight group of people, countries etc have a close relationship with each other
tight.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: Together, the young film-makers formed a tight group.
the tight bonds that had grown between them
tight.translation[0].definitions[10].def: a tight bend or turn is very curved and turns quickly in another direction
tight.translation[0].definitions[10].exa: Danny lost control on a tight bend, and the car ran off the road.
tight.translation[0].definitions[11].def: if your chest, stomach, or throat feels tight, it feels painful and uncomfortable, because you are ill or worried
tight.translation[0].definitions[11].exa: Before she went on stage her chest felt tight and her throat hurt.
tight.translation[0].definitions[12].def: a tight expression, smile, or voice shows that you are annoyed or worried
tight.translation[0].definitions[12].exa: ‘Look, I’m sorry ..., ’ she said, forcing a tight smile.
tight.translation[0].definitions[13].def: playing a piece of music or giving a performance very exactly and well, without any pauses or mistakes
tight.translation[0].definitions[13].exa: The band gave a really tight performance.
tight.translation[0].definitions[14].def: a tight game, competition etc is one in which the teams, players etc play equally well, and it is not easy to win
tight.translation[0].definitions[14].exa: The opening quarter of the game was very tight.
tight.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: I kept my eyes tight shut.
